body.name: Dream On Me Ashton 5-in-1 Convertible Crib in Espresso, Greenguard Gold Certified , 50x36x44 Inch (Pack of 1)
body.stockDetail: Only 15 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 2 hrs 23 mins
features: 4-IN-1 CONVERTIBLE CRIB: A lifetime investment, the Ashton grows with your child, easily converting from a crib into a toddler, day and full-size bed. The toddler guardrail, stabilizer and full-size rail are sold separately

MEET YOUR CHILD’S NEEDS: With 4 mattress height positions, the Ashton can be adjusted according to the age of your baby. Set the mattress at the highest position for your newborn & lower it as your baby starts to pull up to a standing position

DURABLE & STYLISH: The Ashton is built out of solid reclaimed New Zealand Pinewood. With a classic design, this crib offers your little one a sleeping space that will never go out of style. Available in different finishes to match any nursery theme

SAFETY FIRST - ALWAYS: This crib is JPMA Certified to meet or exceed all safety standards set by the CPSC & ASTM. All of our products are tested by 3rd party labs for lead and other toxic elements to meet or exceed CPSC and ASTM safety standards
KEY SPECS: The maximum weight capacity of the crib is 50 lbs. For the best fit, we recommend any Dream On Me or Evolur full-size, non-toxic, Greenguard certified mattress
body.description: The Dream On Me 4-In 1-Ashton Convertible Crib is a lifetime crib that gracefully matures with your child from infancy through childhood and adulthood. Durable yet stylish, this piece of nursery furniture grows with your child transitioning easily into a toddler bed, (Toddler bed rail sold separately) a daybed and full-size bed (full-size bed frame and mattress not included).

Several convertibility options means it grows with your child, it scores high on safety, and a classic design and several finishes mean you can mix and match to create the nursery of your dreams!
Convertibility Options That Keep Pace With Your Growing Child

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent crib, great price
reviews.reviewText: When searching for a crib for our son, I wanted a crib that was good condition that would last through multiple children, nice looking, and affordable. I had never heard of this brand so I looked around for some reviews. It was hard finding many, but decided to purchase it anyways. I do not regret it at all. We've only had it for a short time so if anything bad happens after I write this review I will update it, but I was very pleased when I opened it up. It is a beautiful color, there were no scratches, all the pieces were there and it was fairly simple to put together. (About half way through I needed multiple hands). What I love most though is how sturdy it is. I thought maybe because it was on the cheaper end it would be pretty flimsy, but nope, it is rock solid. I love this crib and am excited to have it for our son. The only negative thing about this crib is that with the shape of the edges (the sides are wavy and the back is curved) it makes it hard to put a mobile up (at least the one that I have). But that isn't really a big deal. It has multiple levels which is nice because it is easier to lay our infant son down at the higher setting. Anyways, a good crib for a good price. I'd recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble, sturdy - overall great value.
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I put this crib together in just under 1 hour. The instructions are easy to follow and the parts are clearly labeled. The packaging did have a few rips and tears in the box, but the product was not damaged at all. We added this to our registry to match the changing table. We are very pleased with the look and sturdy feel of the crib. We’ll update the review, if necessary if anything changes once were getting use out of the crib.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Buyers Read Here.
reviews.reviewText: I can't speak for the 1 🌟 ratings, mine was perfect. All the parts fit, correct hardware and perfect finish.Prior to opening, the box in which the product arrived in was pretty battered. I thought to myself that the product itself was gonna be destroyed. Quite the contrary, I must say. I inspected the product throughly and was looking for missing items or an incomplete set.I think it has something to do with the placement of the protective packaging. It's a great buy but buyers be careful. Anything is possible even with an extreme amount of luck.The sturdiness of the finished product surprised me to say the least. Very firm as if it's one structure not pieced together.Spacious for infants and babies. Adjustments can be made as child age progresses.The crib adverts as 5 in 1 but for bed assembly requires items not included. This is a personal preference but I think this is fa.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy, affordable crib
reviews.reviewText: Update: I have converted the crib to a toddler bed and it was a fairly easy process. Make sure you hold on to the stabilizer bar when you first receive the crib because you will need that when you want to convert it later. The pieces you need to attach it are already being used to keep the side on - plus an allen wrench. I also added a Dream On Me Mesh Security Rail to keep my son from rolling out of bed at night because this crib did not come with a toddler rail. I like the fact that if I want to revert it to a crib I can throw the front back on in probably 20 minutes or less as long as I keep the parts. My only complaint is that I didn't realize how many exposed screw holes there would be on the newly bare inner sides. Not a safety issue but it is unsightly. Either way, the crib has held up to my rough toddler for over a year and is still in use so I'll stick to my 4 star review.Original Review: I purchased this crib for my 22 month old because I plan on converting it to a toddler daybed in the upcoming months, but for the time being I have it set up as a regular crib at the lowest mattress setting. I will update my review when I convert it to include my thoughts on using it as a toddler bed.Others have noted that the espresso color was not true espresso but in my opinion it is close enough. It looks like a rich dark brown and my particular crib has no hints of red in the coloring but it should be a tad darker. With low lamp lighting the crib looks darker than it looks in natural daylight.My crib also arrived with a deep scratch on one of the top rail parts, which is one reason I cannot give it 5 stars. Another reason I only give it 4 stars is because I actually purchased the Dream On Me 96 coil mattress to go along with this crib since they are the same brand and should be compatible, but the mattress is about an inch shorter in length than it should be to fit snugly. That spacing doesn't make much of a difference being that my baby is now a toddler, but if I had a newborn I might be concerned that the mattress is not snug enough in all directions.Otherwise, the crib is very nice to look at and appears to be very sturdy. It took an hour to put together and I would have been able to do it alone but for one part of the assembly I needed another person to come hold the parts up, so having somebody to help you may be necessary. Mine came with instructions but a few of the parts were missing labels and the instructions did not tell you where to put the included dowels. I ended up putting them in the inner holes that were only indented on one side of the wood, maybe this is common knowledge but it wasn't to me and I had to guess. The crib comes with an extra stabilizer bar to replace the front side at its lowest level for when you convert it to a toddler bed but does not come with a toddler bed rail.For the price (under $150) this was definitely a worthwhile purchase and works well for my needs at the moment. My son enjoys his new crib which is the most important feature for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great crib and customer service
reviews.reviewText: I had purchased this crib 5 years ago when my first son was born, and used it up until the toddler bed stage. Now that my son is older, he has a different bed while I am using the crib for my second baby. Through the years I had lost some of the hardware for the crib setup, and contacted customer service to receive a replacement and their service was fast and efficient! I plan to convert the crib to the adult bed once my daughter is done needing the toddler phase, and my son will be ready for a bigger bed. I couldn’t be happier with the crib and the customer service!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best
reviews.reviewText: This is a beautifully made bed! It is a 5in1 which makes it a lot easier in the long run on your finances. This crib is a great investment, I really love how the top sides are rounded that way they're not going to hit their head on me sharp corners it really seems to be made with good quality and it is just easily for a growing baby all the way up till there an adult it was really easy to put together and my daughter just loves it! I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a well-made crib that lasts a lifetime for their child

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's been great!
reviews.reviewText: We bought this crib 2 years ago. It was a snap to assemble. It's been really sturdy over the years, even with our older kid occasionally climbing on it. We misplaced the hardware during a move and the company sent a new set really quickly! We really love this crib and the company!
